intro: Pimpinella brachycarpa var. koreana, commonly known as Korean short-fruited cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its fruits are small, spherical, and clustered in dense umbels, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and small animals.
